ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Send image of the residuals (i.e., data - model) to ds9.

DESC.PARA: Sends an image of the residuals to the imager--by default, ds9. The data set is a 2-D data set. The residuals are of the model subtracted from the data.

LIST.ITEM: id - the id of the data set to use; if not given, uses the default dataset id (id=1 by default, see "ahelp get_default_id")
newframe - add a new frame; default=False

DESC.PARA: The image_resid function can be called with no arguments, in which case an image of the residuals associated with the default data set is sent to ds9. By default, the image is sent to the same frame and the frames are not tiled.

BUGS.PARA: See the bugs pages on the Sherpa website for an up-to-date listing of known bugs.
